'''Pablo Javier Zabaleta Girod''' ({{IPA-es|ˈpaβlo saβaˈleta|am}}; born 16 January 1985<ref name=MCFC2014/>) is an Argentine professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[Defender (association football)#Full-back|right-back]] for English {{English football updater|WestHamU}} club [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]] and the [[Argentina national football team|Argentina national team]]. Zabaleta can operate on both sides of the pitch as a [[Defender (association football)#Full-back|full-back]] and is known for his tenacious style of play, and has [[Captain (association football)|captained]] his club on numerous occasions.
With [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]], Zabaleta won all of English football's major honours: the [[FA Cup]] ([[2010–11 FA Cup|2011]]), the Premier League ([[2011–12 Premier League|2012]] and 2014), and the [[EFL Cup|League Cup]] ([[2013–14 Football League Cup|2014]] and 2016). Before joining Manchester City, Zabaleta played for [[La Liga]] club [[RCD Espanyol]], where he won the [[2005–06 Copa del Rey]].<ref>{{cite news|url=https://uk.eurosport.yahoo.com/football/players/pablo-zabaleta/|title=Pablo Zabaleta|accessdate=22 April 2014|publisher=Eurosport}}</ref> He made 333 appearances over nine seasons for Manchester City before signing for London-based club West Ham United in the summer of 2017.
A full international since 2005, Zabaleta represented Argentina at the [[2011 Copa América|2011]] and [[2015 Copa América]], and was part of their team which finished as runners-up in the [[2014 FIFA World Cup]]. He was also in their team which won gold at the [[Football at the 2008 Summer Olympics – Men's tournament|2008 Olympics]].
==Club career== ===San Lorenzo=== Born in [[Buenos Aires]], Zabaleta was raised in [[Arrecifes]]. He began his career at [[Club Atlético San Lorenzo de Almagro]] in 2002 after progressing through their youth ranks, having been signed at the age of 12 from local club ''Obras Sanitarias''. He started playing as a [[defensive midfielder]] but eventually moved to the right side of midfield.
===Espanyol=== Zabaleta was transferred to [[RCD Espanyol|Espanyol]] in 2005 for €3 million after being [[Argentina national under-20 football team|Argentina under-20]]s [[Captain (association football)|captain]] in the [[2005 FIFA World Youth Championship]], which Argentina won. During the [[2005–06 La Liga|2005–06 season]], Zabaleta helped Espanyol to win the [[2005–06 Copa del Rey|Copa del Rey]], playing the full 90 minutes in the 4–1 defeat of [[Real Zaragoza]] in [[2006 Copa del Rey Final|the final]].<ref name="paradise">{{Cite news |title=Zabaleta rejects Juventus in favour of move to 'paradise' |last=Taylor |first=Daniel |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2008/aug/29/manchestercity.espanyolzabaleta |newspaper=The Guardian |date=29 August 2008 |location=London}}</ref>
In January 2007, Zabaleta suffered a [[shoulder]] injury that kept him off the pitch for almost three months, already having established himself as an undisputed first team choice. Later in the season, he featured in the [[2006–07 UEFA Cup]] [[2007 UEFA Cup Final|final]], where Espanyol lost on penalties to fellow Spanish side [[Sevilla FC|Sevilla]].
===Manchester City=== ====2008–2012==== [[File:Pablo Zabaleta ready to throw vs Bolton.jpg|thumb|180px|right|Zabaleta playing for [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]] in 2009]]
In the summer of 2008, Zabaleta transferred to [[Premier League]] club [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]] after rejecting an offer from [[Juventus F.C.|Juventus]]. He stated upon joining that "the offer of Manchester City is impossible to reject."<ref>{{Cite news |title=Espanyol's Zabaleta turns down Juventus to join Man City for £6.5m |url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-1050567/Espanyols-Zabaleta-turns-Juventus-join-Man-City-6-5m.html |newspaper=Daily Mail |date=29 August 2008 |location=London |first=Ian |last=Ladyman}}</ref> Having passed a medical and agreed personal terms, Zabaleta completed a five-year deal with City on 31 August 2008 for an undisclosed fee, believed to be the buy-out clause Zabaleta had attached to his contract of around £6.45 million.<ref name=paradise/> Zabaleta joined a day before Manchester City was bought by the [[Abu Dhabi United Group]], led by [[Sheikh Mansour]], which enabled a wealth of investment in the club.
On 13 September 2008, Zabaleta made his debut for Manchester City in a 3–1 defeat to [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] at the [[City of Manchester Stadium]]. On 5 October, he received his first [[Penalty card#Red card|red card]] in English football when he was sent off in a 3–2 loss to [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]] in his fourth Premier League appearance. He scored his first goal for City on 17 January 2009, the only goal of the game in a 1–0 league win over [[Wigan Athletic F.C.|Wigan Athletic]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/eng_prem/7815631.stm|title=Man City 1–0 Wigan|publisher=BBC|date=17 January 2009|accessdate=2 January 2010|first=Chris|last=Bevan}}</ref>
On 21 November 2010, Zabaleta scored his second Premier League goal in Manchester City's 4–1 win against [[Fulham F.C.|Fulham]]. In the same match, he [[Assist (football)|assisted]] a [[Carlos Tevez]] goal, helping his compatriot to earn his ninth goal for the club during the [[2010–11 Manchester City F.C. season|2010–11]] season.<ref>{{Cite news |title=Fulham 1–4 Manchester City |url=http://soccernet.espn.go.com/report/_/id/293144?cc=5901 |publisher=ESPN Soccernet |date=21 November 2010}}</ref>
On 1 January 2011, Zabaleta played his 100th game for Manchester City in all competitions, coming off the bench against [[Blackpool F.C.|Blackpool]] in a 1–0 win at Eastlands. Two weeks later, on 15 January, Zabaleta made his second assist of the season in a 4–3 win over [[Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.|Wolverhampton Wanderers]].<ref>{{Cite news |title=Manchester 4–3 Wolves |url=http://soccernet.espn.go.com/match?id=293123&cc=5901 |publisher=ESPN Soccernet |date=15 January 2011}}</ref> This win meant that City went top of [[2010–11 Premier League|the league]] above [[Manchester derby|local rivals]] [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]]. However, City's title challenge faded with a loss of form in February and March 2011.
On 1 May 2011, Zabaleta scored his second goal of the season in a Premier League match against [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]]. This secured a 2–1 win for the Citizens and put them seven points ahead of [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]] and [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]] in the race for [[2011–12 UEFA Champions League|fourth place]].<ref>{{Cite news |title=Manchester City 2–1 West Ham |url=http://soccernet.espn.go.com/report/_/id/293139?cc=5739 |publisher=ESPN Soccernet |date=1 May 2011}}</ref>
On 14 May 2011, Zabaleta appeared as an 88th-minute [[Substitute (association football)|substitute]] for Carlos Tevez in the [[2011 FA Cup Final]] as Manchester City beat [[Stoke City F.C.|Stoke City]] 1–0.<ref name=11cup>{{cite news|last=Gibbs|first=Thom|title=FA Cup final 2011: Manchester City v Stoke City live|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/competitions/fa-cup/8513729/FA-Cup-final-2011-Manchester-City-v-Stoke-City-live.html|accessdate=6 March 2014|newspaper=[[The Daily Telegraph]]|date=14 May 2011|location=London}}</ref>
In the summer of 2011, it was reported that Italian club [[A.S. Roma|Roma]] were keen on signing Zabaleta, but Manchester City insisted the player was not for sale<ref>{{Cite news |title=Roma to launch £6m Zabaleta bid, but Manchester City unwilling to sell Argentina defender |url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-2014502/Roma-launch-6m-bid-Pablo-Zabaleta-Manchester-City-unwilling-sell-Argentina-defender.html |newspaper=Daily Mail |date=14 July 2011 |location=London}}</ref> and Zabaleta agreed a three-year contract in July 2011. On 1 October 2011, Zabaleta started and played the full 90 minutes at right-back in a 4–0 win over [[Blackburn Rovers F.C.|Blackburn Rovers]] at [[Ewood Park]] in the Premier League, as regular starter [[Micah Richards]] was not available. On 23 October, he was an unused substitute in the convincing 1–6 win over rivals Manchester United at [[Old Trafford]], with Richards starting at right-back.<ref>{{Cite news |title=Zabaleta agrees three-year deal |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/premier-league/zabaleta-agrees-threeyear-deal-2318961.html |newspaper=The Independent |date=23 July 2011 |location=London}}</ref>
In November 2011, Zabaleta extended his contract with City until the summer of 2015. Zabaleta said, "I'm in a very good team, and I try to do my best for the club, the team and the fans. I didn't think twice, I gave a quick answer because I was so happy to sign."<ref>{{cite news| url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-2063216/Manchester-City-new-deals-Adam-Johnson-Pablo-Zabaleta.html | location=London | newspaper=Daily Mail | title=Going places! Johnson hails City ambition as he joins Zabaleta in agreeing new deal | date=18 November 2011}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |title=City tie down Johnson and Zabaleta |url=http://www.uefa.com/uefachampionsleague/news/newsid=1717452.html |date=18 November 2011 |publisher=[[UEFA]] |access-date=29 June 2016}}</ref> In his first three-and-a-half years at the club, Zabaleta emerged as a cult hero amongst the Manchester City fans who admire his never-say-die attitude and commitment to the club.
On 30 April 2012, he started and played the full 90 minutes in the right-back slot in a 1–0 victory over rivals Manchester United thanks to a first-half stoppage time header by [[Vincent Kompany]] from a corner at the City of Manchester Stadium. Zabaleta scored the first goal in City's dramatic 3–2 win over [[Queens Park Rangers F.C.|Queens Park Rangers]] on the final day of the [[2011–12 Premier League|season]], a result which secured the first league title for the club since 1968.<ref>{{cite news|title=Man City 3 QPR 2|url=http://www.thesun.co.uk/sol/homepage/sport/football/4313835/Man-City-3-2-QPR-Match-report-pictures-video-highlights.html|newspaper=The Sun|location=London|first=Shaun|last=Custis}}</ref> On 9 December 2012, Zabaleta scored a late equalising goal in a 3–2 defeat to Manchester United.
====2013–2017==== [[File:Zabaleta Negredo league cup.JPG|thumb|left|180px|Zabaleta and [[Álvaro Negredo]] with the trophy after the [[2014 Football League Cup Final|2014 League Cup Final]]]]
On 1 January 2013, he scored the opening goal in a 3–0 win at the City of Manchester Stadium over Stoke City, doubling his goal tally from the previous season. On 25 January 2013, Zabaleta scored his third goal of the season and the only goal of the match in a 1–0 win away against Stoke City in the [[2012–13 FA Cup|FA Cup]], fourth round. His goal took Manchester City through to the fifth round.
Zabaleta was voted Manchester City's Player of the Month for both December 2012<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.mcfc.co.uk/News/Team-news/2013/January/Zaba-wins-Etihad-prize|title=Zabaleta is Etihad Player of the Month|date=7 January 2013|publisher=Manchester City F.C.}}</ref> and January 2013,<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.mcfc.co.uk/News/Team-news/2013/February/Zabaleta-wins-January-Etihad-Player-of-the-Month|title=Zabaleta voted Etihad Player of the Month|date=11 February 2013|publisher=Manchester City F.C.}}</ref> and was stand-in captain for the club during [[Vincent Kompany]]'s injury absence between January and March 2013.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.mirror.co.uk/sport/football/manchester-city-missing-uniteds-winning-1786570|title=Mind games: Manchester City are missing United's winning mentality, admits Pablo Zabaleta|date=26 March 2013|access-date=22 February 2015|newspaper=Daily Mirror}}</ref> He was the only City player to be named in the 2012–13 Premier League [[PFA Team of the Year]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Gareth Bale wins PFA Player of Year and Young Player awards|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/22331030|publisher=BBC Sport|date=28 April 2013|accessdate=2 May 2013}}</ref> After a superb season, Zabaleta was voted 2012–13 Manchester City Player of the Year.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.mcfc.co.uk/news/team-news/2013/june/zabaleta-named-player-of-the-year|title=Pablo Zabaleta is Manchester City Player of the Year|date=4 June 2013|publisher=Manchester City F.C.|accessdate=21 June 2013}}</ref>
Zabaleta was sent off in the [[2013 FA Cup Final]] against Wigan Athletic for a second [[Penalty card#Yellow card|yellow card]] after a clear foul on [[Callum McManaman]] 84 minutes into the match. Wigan went on to win 1–0 through a [[Ben Watson (footballer, born July 1985)|Ben Watson]] goal in stoppage time. He was the third player to be sent off in an FA Cup final and first for the losing side.
On 2 March 2014, Zabaleta played the full 90 minutes as Manchester City beat [[Sunderland A.F.C.|Sunderland]] 3–1 in the [[2014 Football League Cup Final|2014 League Cup Final]] to complete a full set of major honours in English football.<ref name=14cup>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/26311649|title=Man City 3–1 Sunderland|date=2 March 2014|publisher=BBC Sport}}</ref> On 21 April, he scored his first goal of the season in a 3–1 defeat of West Bromwich Albion at the City of Manchester Stadium.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/27017161|title=Man City 3–1 West Brom|date=21 April 2014|accessdate=22 April 2014|publisher=BBC Sport}}</ref> On 11 May, Zabaleta was part of the victory against West Ham that won Manchester City the Premier League, his second in three seasons.
On 21 September 2014, Zabaleta was sent off for a second [[Penalty card#Yellow card|yellow card]] due to a challenge on Chelsea's [[Diego Costa]]. Both players received a yellow card, Zabaleta for the initial challenge and Costa for his reaction.
On 21 August 2015, it was announced that Zabaleta was out for a month with knee injury.<ref>{{cite web|title=Manchester City's Pablo Zabaleta out for month with knee injury|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/34018567|publisher=BBC Sport|date=21 August 2015|accessdate=21 August 2015}}</ref> On 17 January 2016, Zabaleta reached 200 appearances for Manchester City in the club's 4–0 victory over [[Crystal Palace F.C.|Crystal Palace]].<ref>{{cite web |title=Zabaleta proud to be 'half Mancunian' after 200th City appearance |url=http://www.goal.com/en-us/news/85/england/2016/01/17/19416502/zabaleta-proud-to-be-half-mancunian-after-300th-city |date=17 January 2016 |website=Goal.com |accessdate=29 June 2016}}</ref>
Zabaleta made 32 appearances in all competitions in the 2016–17 season scoring two goals; against [[Watford F.C.|Watford]] in the Premier League and against [[Huddersfield Town A.F.C.|Huddersfield Town]] in the FA Cup. His final appearance for Manchester City came on 16 May 2017, a 3–1 home win against [[West Bromwich Albion F.C.|West Bromwich Albion]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/39853090|title=Manchester City 3–1 West Bromwich Albion|publisher=BBC Sport|first=Chris|last=Bevan|date=16 May 2017|accessdate=29 October 2018}}</ref> After the game he was praised by the City manager, [[Pep Guardiola]], as a "legend".<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/video/2017/may/17/manchester-city-guardiola-praises-legend-zabaleta-after-west-brom-win-video|title=Manchester City’s Guardiola praises ‘legend’ Zabaleta after West Brom win – video|newspaper=The Guardian|date=17 May 2017}}</ref> Zabaleta was given a lifetime season ticket for Manchester City and a shirt that read “Zabaleta 333”, to mark the number of City appearances he made.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2017/may/16/manchester-city-west-bromwich-albion-premier-league-match-report|title=Manchester City bid farewell to Pablo Zabaleta after crucial West Brom win|first=Jamie|last=Jackson|date=16 May 2017|newspaper=The Guardian}}</ref>
===West Ham United=== On 26 May 2017, Zabaleta signed for [[Premier League]] club [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]] on a free transfer, agreeing to a two-year contract. He was given number five as his squad number.<ref>{{cite web|title=Joint-Chairman hails ‘supreme professional’ Zabaleta|url=http://www.whufc.com/news/articles/2017/may/26-may/joint-chairman-hails-supreme-professional-zabaleta|publisher=West Ham United F.C.|date=26 May 2017|accessdate=26 May 2017}}</ref>
On 22 May 2018, [[Manuel Pellegrini]] was confirmed as manager of [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]],<ref name=WestHamIn>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/44163423 |title=West Ham: Manuel Pellegrini named new manager at London Stadium |publisher=BBC Sport |date=22 May 2018 |accessdate=22 May 2018}}</ref> reuniting him with his former manager at [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]].
==International career== [[File:MessiZabaletaBanega.jpg|thumb|190px|Zabaleta (middle) before a game against Croatia, 2014]]
At the age of 14, Zabaleta was called up by [[Hugo Tocalli]] to the Argentina under-15 squad. He took part in many youth tournaments, including the [[FIFA U-20 World Cup]] in [[2003 FIFA World Youth Championship|2003]] and [[2005 FIFA World Youth Championship|2005]], winning the latter in the [[Netherlands]]. He received over 75 caps to national youth sides, and started representing [[Argentina national football team|the senior side]] in 2005. He was also a member of the gold medal-winning team at the [[Football at the 2008 Summer Olympics – Men's tournament|2008 Summer Olympics]], starting at right-back and playing all six matches.
After the [[2010 FIFA World Cup]], for which Zabaleta was not selected by head coach [[Diego Maradona]], under the new Argentina manager he has established himself as first-choice right-back. On 1 June 2011, Zabaleta captained Argentina for the first time in a friendly against [[Nigeria national football team|Nigeria]].
In June 2014, Zabaleta was named in Argentina's squad for the [[2014 FIFA World Cup|2014 World Cup]].<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.fifa.com/worldcup/news/y=2014/m=6/news=demichelis-in-argentina-squad-as-trio-miss-out-2353431.html|title=Demichelis in Argentina squad as trio miss out|date=2 June 2014|accessdate=21 June 2014|publisher=FIFA}}</ref> He made his [[FIFA World Cup|World Cup]] debut in Argentina's 2–1 win over [[Bosnia and Herzegovina national football team|Bosnia and Herzegovina]] at the [[Estádio do Maracanã]], playing the full match in defence.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/25285099|title=Argentina 2–1 Bos-Herce|date=16 June 2014|accessdate=21 June 2014|publisher=BBC Sport}}</ref>
At the [[2015 Copa América]] in Chile, Zabaleta sent in the cross from which his Manchester City teammate [[Sergio Agüero]] headed the only goal of the game as Argentina defeated holders [[Uruguay national football team|Uruguay]] in their second [[2015 Copa América Group B|group]] match.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/33085567|title=Argentina 1–0 Uruguay|date=17 June 2015|publisher=BBC Sport}}</ref>
==Personal life== Zabaleta was born in [[Buenos Aires]], to a family of Basque descent.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.euskalkultura.com/espanol/noticias/el-delantero-uruguayo-diego-forlan-su-abuela-vasca-y-sus-deseos-de-fichar-por-el-athletic-club-de-bilbao|title=El delantero uruguayo Diego Forlán, su abuela vasca, y sus deseos de fichar por el Athlétic Club de Bilbao|publisher=EuskalKultura.com}}</ref> Zabaleta has a tattoo on his chest which bears the name of his mother.<ref>{{cite news|title=Pablo Zabaleta espera duro partido para Argentina contra Holanda|url=https://ecodiario.eleconomista.es/global/noticias/702153/08/08/Pablo-Zabaleta-espera-duro-partido-para-Argentina-contra-Holanda.html|newspaper=El Economista|date=13 August 2008|accessdate=30 August 2011}}</ref> In June 2018, he worked as a pundit for the BBC's [[Match of the Day]] [[2018 FIFA World Cup|2018 World Cup]] coverage from Russia.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/44568837|title=World Cup 2018: 'Everyone is so angry' – Pablo Zabaleta reacts to Argentina defeat|date=21 June 2018|accessdate=22 June 2018|publisher=BBC Sport}}</ref>
